alert.note: Alert for Guadalupe (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 13 at 1:10AM CDT until further notice by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following counties, Atascosa, Bexar, Blanco, Comal, Guadalupe, Karnes, Kendall and Wilson. * WHEN...Until 500 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 110 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Antonio, New Braunfels, San Marcos, Schertz, Seguin, Cibolo, Universal City, Live Oak, Boerne, Pleasanton, Selma, Floresville, Jourdanton, Poteet, Poth, Charlotte, Christine, Stinson Municipal Airport, San Antonio Int Airport and Randolph AFB. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
